{{ddcl|header=fstream|1=
template&lt;
    class CharT,
    class Traits = std::char_traits&lt;CharT&gt;
&gt; class basic_fstream : public std::basic_iostream&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;
}}

The class template {{tt|basic_fstream}} implements high-level input/output operations on file based streams. It interfaces a file-based streambuffer ({{lc|std::basic_filebuf}}) with the high-level interface of ({{lc|std::basic_iostream}}).

A typical implementation of {{tt|std::basic_fstream}} holds only one non-derived data member: an instance of {{c/core|std::basic_filebuf&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;fstream&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;string&gt;

int main()
{
    std::string filename{"test.bin"};
    std::fstream s{filename, s.binary {{!}} s.trunc {{!}} s.in {{!}} s.out};

    if (!s.is_open())
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "failed to open " &lt;&lt; filename &lt;&lt; '\n';
    else
    {
        // write
        double d{3.14};
        s.write(reinterpret_cast&lt;char*&gt;(&amp;d), sizeof d); // binary output
        s &lt;&lt; 123 &lt;&lt; "abc";                              // text output
        
        // for fstream, this moves the file position pointer (both put and get)
        s.seekp(0);
        
        // read
        d = 2.71828;
        s.read(reinterpret_cast&lt;char*&gt;(&amp;d), sizeof d); // binary input
        int n;
        std::string str;
        if (s &gt;&gt; n &gt;&gt; str)                             // text input
            std::cout &lt;&lt; "read back from file: " &lt;&lt; d &lt;&lt; ' ' &lt;&lt; n &lt;&lt; ' ' &lt;&lt; str &lt;&lt; '\n';
    }
}
|output=
read back from file: 3.14 123 abc
}}
